gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.creation
Class Factory

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.creation.Factory

public class Factory
extends Object

Utility class that serves as a facade hiding the default object factory.

registerFixture

public static <M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                                       M fixture)
Registers a fixture that the underlying ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
This facility is meant to allow developers to specify mock instances to be created for a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarions where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
The fixtures concern only invocations to create(Class).

Parameters:
declarationType - Declaration class
fixture - Instance to be returned upon a request for a declarationType object creation

registerFixture

public static <M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                                       ObjectFactory fixtureFactory)
Registers a fixture that the underlying ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
This facility is meant to allow developers to specify ObjectFactory instances that will be used for the instantiation of a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarios where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
The fixtures only affect calls to the create(Class) method of this ObjectFactory.

Type Parameters:
M - Type of fixture.
Parameters:
declarationType - Declaration class
fixtureFactory - ObjectFactory that will actually perform the instantiation.

resetFixtures

public static void resetFixtures()
Resets any fixtures configured programmatically to the underlying ObjectFactory using registerFixture(Class, Object)

nullSafe

public static <M> M nullSafe(M value,
                             Class<M> type)
Makes sure that a reference to an object is not null. If value is null, then the method will create a new object, otherwise it will return the same value.

Type Parameters:
M - type of object.
Parameters:
type - Type of object to be created.
value - Value
Returns:
Returns an object of the specified type that is never null.

compileJavaBean

public static Class<?> compileJavaBean(String className,
                                       VariableDefinition<?>[] properties)
Compiles a new java bean class and registers it as declaration class in the current factory. This method is synchronized. Waiting threads will find the class already existing.

Parameters:
className - Name of class.
properties - Array of pairs containing property name left and property type name right. These are the java bean's properties.
Returns:
Returns the class.

getDefaultDetachStrategy

.

Parameters:
clazz - Class
Returns:
Returns the detach strategy of the specified object.
